intro: Porroglossum josei, commonly known as the mountain pincushion, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly in regions of Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flower heads that are surrounded by bracts resembling a pincushion, giving it its common name. Porroglossum josei typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in rocky and arid conditions. Its botanical features make it a unique and visually striking addition to alpine flora.
